reviewText: Loved "Gloria" with Gena Rowlands! Incredible actress! Cassavetes brilliant directing!
Gloria 1980 is the best!
I am very pleased with this purchased, however, the original "Gloria" is my favorite.
No good, it plays only one movie and it keeps skipping,junk
Great movie
This was for my mom. She loved this show and wanted the original and the remake.

I saw both movies individually when they were released to the theaters. I enjoyed both which is unusual. Gena Rowland's Gloria is one tough broad who doesn't take crap from anyone. You do get rare glimpses of her feelings for the kid. Sharon Stone's Gloria is just as tough but she shows great tenderness for the kid. I'm not that big of a Sharon Stone fan. I admit that she has done some pretty good movies but I don't think that she ever reached super stardom but in this one she was right on the money and I did enjoy watching her in this movie. The price on this double feature was fantastic.
gr8 movies
Both versions of this movie are good.  The Gena Rowland's version is a much better film.  Is a good study.  Recommended.

I personally prefer Sharon Stone's Gloria. I think it is an excellent movie, and Sharon Stone has done a great job here. I don't know if she was recognized for this brilliant portrayal or not, and I think it is not important either;  but I found her performance superb. And the script is taut, the direction is excellent, and keeps the viewer's interest to the end. Over-all, a must watch movie.
Sharon Stone was awesome. If I had seen the first  one with Gena Rowlands I would have really missed out. It is rare for the remake to be better but it is much better.
Two Glorias in one. Both are very good. You can  watch them over and over and never get bored. Gena Rowlands was a tough chick with the heart of gold. Bottom line...Great Movie!
It is nice having two movies in one.
Love it
